items.sentence: Didn\'t you know I was hoping Tom would win?
Tom couldn\'t have done what you say he did.
Do you care what kind of music we listen to?
Tom seems a lot happier since you showed up.
Tom seems to be a bit more shaken than Mary.
Tom seems to be in a really good mood today.
Tom seems to be running away from something.
Tom seems to be thoroughly enjoying himself.
Tom seems to really enjoy talking with Mary.
Tom put on his pajamas and climbed into bed.
Tom rubbed his hands in front of the heater.
Does it matter to you if I\'m a little late?
What kind of music will you guys be playing?
What language do you two use to communicate?
Tom and Mary had a huge argument last night.
If Tom comes, won\'t you please let me know?
If it snows tomorrow, I\'ll build a snowman.
I saw Tom\'s car parked in Mary\'s driveway.
I was impressed by the way Tom spoke French.
I wish I had gone to the theater last night.
